review: It has potential, but is too limited at this time for what you can stream. It only supports a single window at a time to cast. As more and more apps are supported, it will be a go-to device. Right now, it does pretty much the same thing as my DVD player.
author: Steve Marlin

review: Great product, excellent delivery time.  Easily installed, video quality is first rate.  There needs to be an interface with the disc drive  on a computer, but I understand that will come in time.

review: Really needs to have the API opened up to developers! There are a lot of features that need to be implemented (well), like streaming files from a computer to the Chromecast, gameplay, etc. Stuff that opening up the API would create the opportunity to be made by third parties.
author: Jorgamun

review: Works great.  It has improved now to the point where it will automatically switch my TV to the right input source for the Chromecast when I start casting, so I don't have to look for the regular remote control.We need the ability to stream personal videos and pictures. I imagine that the personal stuff has been blocked for personal security reasons.  If this is the case then users need to be informed that if they are streaming over a shared network that there is a possibility that the personal stuff may be intercepted.  Then we can adjust and use the device accordingly.I like it enough to have purchased 3. Even if the TV has smart apps I find that searching for content is much easier from the Android device than it was with a Traditional TV or Blu Ray remote control.

review: Doesn't work outside of the US the way you can operate other US-only streaming devices (roku or apple tv). But for the price it's good enough for the YouTube only airplay-like functionality.
